intro: Haplopappus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian pappus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are surrounded by bracts that aid in wind dispersal of its seeds. Haplopappus boliviensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
